column1: Topic title: IRB targeting opposition donors  says Dr Mahathir

column8: text

https://www.themalaysianinsight.com/s/3595/IRB targeting opposition donors, says Dr Mahathir23 May 2017 Dr Mahathir Mohamad says government resorting to all sorts of tactics to hobble the opposition pact’s campaign ahead of the 14th general election. – The Malaysian Insight file pic, May 23, 2017.THE Inland Revenue Board (IRB) is targeting opposition funders, Dr Mahathir Mohamad said at a ceramah yesterday.The former prime minister said the IRB was being used to intimidate those suspected of funding Pakatan Harapan parties, the Malaymail Online reported.PH is made up of Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (Bersatu), DAP, PKR and Amanah.“Now I heard that anyone who wants to donate to Pakatan Harapan will be harassed by LHDN,” he was quoted as saying, referring to the IRB’s Malay acronym.Last night’s ceramah featured senior PH leaders, including Selangor Menteri Besar Mohamed Azmin Ali, DAP national publicity chief Tony Pua and Amanah president Mohammad Sabu.Dr Mahathir implied that the intimidation was to hobble the opposition pact’s campaign ahead of the 14th general election (GE14).“You need posters, buntings, and even to register candidates, it all requires money,” he was quoted as saying.At the same event, Dr Mahathir, the Bersatu chairman, denied “fat shaming” anyone, Malaysiakini reports today. He was responding to Umno Youth chief Khairy Jamaluddin’s earlier criticism that Dr Mahathir was fat shaming a woman.“If he or she is gemuk (fat), then he or she would terasa (feel slighted). That’s not my problem,” Dr Mahathir was quoted as saying.Dr Mahathir at an event on May 16 said he is slim because he does not “makan rasuah” (accept bribes).It is widely understood he was referring to Prime Minister Najib Razak’s wife, Rosmah Mansor.Dr Mahathir has on many occasions accused Najib of wrongdoing in the 1Malaysia Development Bhd scandal, particularly the RM2.6 billion channelled into the prime minister’s bank accounts. – May 23, 2017.

Malaysia like lots of country implement a self filing system.just because that we lodge a filing mean the IRB accept it as it is and case close. they can review it or select any cases and audit your filing. just because we think something is tax deductible doesn't mean they fell the same way.off course all of these things isn't new or even targeted. my cousin a small time auditor are busy these days because IRB keep on asking and enquiring on lodge documents. of course there's a lot of tax evader out there. when you are a country with an estimated 30% of GDP is in the black economy.personally, I blame the parents for stupidity. they indoctrinate their children with illogical concepts that when they become adult they are incapable of rational logical thinking
